data.title: Katy perry
data.meta_description: Katy perry - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text: 1. Katy Perry Katheryn Elizabeth Hudson, better known as “Katy Perry” born October 25, 1984 is an American singer, songwriter and actress. She pursed a career in gospel music in her teenage years In April 2007, she signed a deal with Capitol records where she then rose to fame in 2008 with the release of her singles “I kissed a girl” and “Hot n Cold” from her second album “One of the Boys” Her third album, “Teenage Dream” (2010) was preceded by the U.S. Billboard hot 100 chart topping singles “California Gurls” and “Teenage Dream” and later produced the number one singles “Firework” and “E.T” The album became the first by a female artist to produce five number one Billboard Hot 100 songs and the second overall after Michael Jackson’s album “Bad” Katy Perry has received many awards and nominations including three Guinness World Records and been included in the Forbes list of “Top- Earning Women in Music for 2011, 2012 and 2013 . Throughout her carer she has sold 11 million albums and 81 million singles worldwide making her one of the best-selling artists of all times Transitioning from gospel music to secular music, she started writing songs with producer Glen Ballard, and moved to Los Angeles at 17. In 2003 she performed once as Katheryn Perry to avoid confusion with Kate Hudson After finishing the Warped Tour 2008, Perry embarked on her first headlining tour , the “Hello Katy” tour from January 23, 2009 to November 2009. On August 4, 2009 she performed as an opening act for one date of the band “No doubt’s” Summer tour 2009 After serving as a guest judge on American Idol, Perry released “California Gurls” featuring rapper Snoop Dogg on May 7, 2010. The song was the lead single from her third studio album “Teenage Dream” and reached number one in the Billboard Hot 100 in June. She also served as a guest judge for Xfactor UK later that month A remixed version of “E.T” featuring rapper, Kanye West, was released as the fourth single from “Teenage Dream” on February 16, 2011. It topped the Hot 100 chart for five non consecutive weeks making “Teenage Dream” the ninth album in history to produce four number one singles on the Hot 100 From February 20, 2011, to January 22, 2012 Perry embarked on the California Dreams Tour in support of Teenage Dream, grossing over $59 million globally. On September 23, 2011 she performed the opening day of the 2011 Rock in Rio festival along with Elton John , Claudia Leitte and Rihanna
